info.name: Leap API
info.description: ## Introduction Welcome to Leap API. Leap API is a powerful way to communicate with Leap resources. Leap' API exposes endpoints to communicate with Leap using the programming language of your choice. Leap API is a RESTful API based on HTTP requests and JSON responses. This version of the API, version 3.0, uses OAuth 2.0. This means that all requests need to be encrypted and sent via HTTPS and to call any API endpoint, an access token is required. The API access token can be generated from the Leap dashboard. # API Base URL ##### Base URL `https://api.jobprogress.com/api/v3` > Full URL to get the list of all customers [https://api.jobprogress.com/api/v3/customers](https://api.jobprogress.com/api/v3/customers) # Authentication You'll need an access token to interact with the Leap API. To get your access token, log in to your Leap account and visit Settings -> Developer page. If you are already logged in then [click here](https://www.jobprogress.com/app/#/settings/developers) to generate an access token. Note: As of now only admin users are able to generate the access tokens. So if you don't have an admin account please contact your admin. Make sure to pass the access token in the below format when you make a request to Leap API. `Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN` # Includes\[\] Most of our GET APIs support a way to demand additional data along with the primary Resource. You can specify that by sending an `includes[]` param with the request. For example, if you get a list of jobs then you can send `address` and `customer` in the includes to have them added to the response. Your request will look like below: Example: `/jobs?includes[]=address&includes[]=job` A list of valid include values is provided in the individual sections of the API endpoints. # Data Limit In the listing, endpoints like Jobs listing number of items to be returned is limited to 10 by default. It can be changed with the `limit` parameter and the limit can be up 100 items per request. Example: `/jobs?limit=20` # Errors The API makes use of the standard HTTP codes to communicate the response type. The following are the most commonly returned status codes. | Error Code | Meaning | | --- | --- | | 200 | Success Response -- Your HTTP request is successful. | | 413 | Bad Request -- Your request data is invalid. | | 401 | Unauthorized -- Your API key is wrong or API key is missing. | | 403 | Forbidden -- The resource requested is hidden for administrators only. | | 404 | Not Found -- The specified resource could not be found. | | 405 | Method Not Allowed -- You tried to access a resource with an invalid method. | | 429 | Too Many Requests -- You're requesting too much! Slow down! | | 500 | Internal Server Error -- Something went wrong while processing the request. You can either try again or you can contact us for support. | | 503 | Service Unavailable -- We're temporarily offline for maintenance. | # Webhooks The Leap REST APIs use webhooks for event notification. Webhooks allows to send real-time data from one application to another whenever a given event occurs. These are HTTP callbacks that contains notification messages for events. After you configure a webhook listener for your app, you can create a webhook, which subscribes the webhook listener for your app to specific events. ### Anatomy of a webhook Once a webhook subscription is configured, a webhook notification will trigger each time the events that you specified occur. This notification contains a JSON payload as following: ``` json [ { "action" : "customers", "operation" : "create" "id" : 1 }, { "action": "jobs", "operation": "create", "id": 5793933, "details": { "job_address": "525 North Mission Road Los Angeles, CA 90033", "job_number": "2502-6554957-02", "customer_name": "Kayla Dibbert", "job_name": "Install New shingle", "customer_id": 6554957 } }, { "action": "jobs", "operation": "stage_change", "id": 5793933, "stage_moved_from": { "name": "Lead capture", "code": "1921044368" }, "stage_moved_to": { "name": "Paid", "code": "2089617307" } "details": { "job_address": "525 North Mission Road Los Angeles, CA 90033", "job_number": "2502-6554957-02", "customer_name": "Kayla Dibbert", "job_name": "Install New shingle", "customer_id": 6554957 } } ] ``` ### Batching You can receive multiple notifications in a single request and payload can contain maximum 100 notifications. There can be delay of upto 2 minutes in sending notification. Currently we are sending notification on following events. - Customer Create - Job Create - Job Stage Change ### Error/Failure/Timeout Case 1 - We ensure the notification is triggered if the web server returns 200 code notification. Otherwise, it's considered as a failure and we’re trying it for 2 times further keeping interval of 3 hours (initial notification) and 24 hours (if failed). Case 2 - Once the notification is triggered, we'll wait for 10 seconds, if no response received then that notification will be marked as failure. # Need help? The Leap team is always around answering questions. The quickest way to reach us is via email [support@jobprogress.com](https://mailto:support@jobprogress.com)

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves all customers of the company.

#### Request Params

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **includes\[\]** | Options available: `phones, address, billing, rep, jobs, contacts, canvasser, call_center_rep, referred_by` |

> Example 
  

#### includes\[\] Details

> phones 
  

The Phone number information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"phones": {
    "data": [
        {
            "label": "home",
            "number": "1111122222",
            "ext": null
        }
    ]
}

 ```

phones field will have the list of Phone numbers associated with the customer.

##### Phones field detail

- **label**: Phone number label for example. Home, office.
    
- **number**: Phone number.
    
- **ext**: Optional phone number extension for example. +1.
    

> address 
  

The customer address information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"address": {
      "id": 327,
      "address": "Teasley Lane",
      "address_line_1": "",
      "city": "",
      "state_id": 5,
      "state": {
          "id": 5,
          "name": "California",
          "code": "CA",
          "country_id": 1
      },
      "country_id": 1,
      "country": {
          "id": 1,
          "name": "United States",
          "code": "US",
          "phone_code": "+1"
      },
      "zip": "77375",
      "lat": 10.812973,
      "long": -16.978363
  }

 ```

Address will have all the information related job like address id, state country, postcode etc.

##### Address field detail

- **id**: Unique address id
    
- **address**: The street address
    
- **address_line_1**: An optional additional field for the street address
    
- **city**: The city, town, or village of the address
    
- **state**: State information of the address
    
- **country_id**: Id of the Country associated with the address
    
- **country**: Country information of the address with all the details.
    
- **lat**: The latitude of the address.
    
- **long**: The longitude of the address.
    

> billing 
  

The billing address of the customer and fields will be the same as customer address.

> rep 
  

The Representative information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"rep": {
    "id": 25,
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "company_id": 6,
    "company": "John Constructions",
    "admin_privilege": false,
    "group": {
        "id": 5,
        "name": "owner"
    },
    "added_date": "2019-11-15 05:53:09",
    "profile_pic": null,
    "active": true,
    "company_name": null,
    "color": "blue",
    "role": [
        {
            "name": "plus-admin"
        }
    ]  
}

 ```

rep field will have information of Representative associated with the customer.

##### Rep field detail

- **id**: Unique representative id
    
- **first_name**: First name of the representative.
    
- **last_name**: Last name of the representative.
    
- **email**: Email of the representative.
    
- **company_id**: Company id of the representative associated with.
    
- **company**: Company details of the representative.
    
- **admin_privilege**: shows if representative has admin privileges or not.
    
- **group**: User group information of the representative.
    
- **added_date**: The date and time when the representative was created in the system.
    
- **profile_pic**: Profile picture of the representative.
    
- **active**: Shows if representative is active or not.
    
- **company_name**: Company name of the representative if user is commercial.
    
- **color**: Color information associated with representative.
    
- **role**: Role information of the representative.
    

> jobs 
  

The Job information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"jobs": {
     "data": [
         {
             "id": 175,
             "name": "Test Job",
             "number": "1911-170-01",
             "customer_id": 170,
             "description": "Job test 023456789",
             "same_as_customer_address": 1,
             "other_trade_type_description": null,
             "created_by": 27,
             "created_at": "2019-11-29 13:33:00",
             "created_date": "2019-11-29 13:33:00",
             "updated_at": "2019-11-29 13:33:01",
             "deleted_at": null,
             "call_required": false,
             "appointment_required": false,
             "tax_rate": null,
             "alt_id": "1",
             "lead_number": "",
             "duration": "0:0:0",
             "completion_date": null,
             "contract_signed_date": null,
             "current_stage": {
                 "name": "Lead",
                 "color": "cl-red",
                 "code": "1866233278"
             },
             "contact_same_as_customer": 1,
             "insurance": 0,
             "archived": null,
             "multi_job": 0
         }
     ]
 }

 ```

jobs field will have the list of jobs associated with the customer.

##### Jobs field detail

- **id**: Unique job id
    
- **name**: Job name.
    
- **number**: Job number
    
- **customer_id**: Customer id associated with job.
    
- **description**: Job description.
    
- **same_as_customer_address**: If job address is same as customer address.
    
- **other_trade_type_description**: if `trades` is `other` then this field will have other trade note.
    
- **created_by**: User id who created the job.
    
- **created_at**: The date and time when the customer was created.
    
- **updated_at**: The date and time when the job last updated.
    
- **deleted_at**: The date and time when the job as deleted.
    
- **call_required**: If call required or not when added.
    
- **appointment_required**: If appointment required or not when added.
    
- **tax_rate**: Tax rate information.
    
- **alt_id**: Alternate job id.
    
- **lead_number**: Lead number.
    
- **duration**: Duration of the job.
    
- **completion_date**: Date time when job was completed.
    
- **contract_signed_date**: Date time when contract was signed.
    
- **current_stage**: Job stage information.
    
- **contact_same_as_customer**: If Contact user is same as customer.
    
- **insurance**: If job has insurance or not.
    
- **archived**: If job is archived or not.
    
- **multi_job**: if job is multiple jobs in single jobs.
    

> contacts 
  

The contacts information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
 "contacts": {
     "data": [
         {
             "id": 85,
             "first_name": "John",
             "last_name": "doe"
         }
     ]
 }

 ```

contacts field will have the list of contacts associated with the customer.

##### Contacts field detail

- **id**: Unique contact id
    
- **first_name**: Contact first name.
    
- **last_name**: Contact last name.
    

#### Request Params (for filtering)

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **trades\[\]** | Array of trades ids |
| **stages\[\]** | Array of stage codes |
| **rep_ids** | Array of customer's **rep Ids** or **(string) unassigned** |
| **job_number** | Job number |
| **address** | Customers address |
| **job_address** | Job address |
| **phone** | customers phone number |
| **email** | customers email address |
| **name** | customers full name |
| **id** | Customer id |
| **states\[\]** | Array of State ids e.g, \[1,2\] |
| **has_jobs** | Boolean **1 (true) or 0 (false)** |
| **zip_code** | customer address zip code |
| **city** | city name |
| **cities\[\]** | name of cities |
| **referred_by_type** | referred by type \[**referred_by** : referred by id\] |
| **job_contact_person** | first name, last name(job contact) |
| **commercial** | (optional, boolean)(0/1) |
| **deleted_customers_duration** | (optional, boolean)(0/1) |
| **date_range_type** | Date range type filter (options: customer_created_date or customer_updated_date). This filter will only work when start date or end date filter will come. |
| **start_date** | Start date (optional: date, The date format must be Y-m-d) |
| **end_date** | End date (optional: date, The date format must be Y-m-d) |
| **job_alt_id** | Customer Job's Alt id (Job #) |
| **first_name** | Customer's First Name |
| **last_name** | Customer's Last Name |
| **country_id** | Country id of the customer's address |
| **customer_note** | Customer's Note |
| **job_rep_ids\[\]** | Array of job's rep ids |
| **flag_ids\[\]** | Customer’s Flag Ids |
| **company_name** | Customer's company name |
| **property_name** | Customer's Property Name |
| **management_company** | Customer's Management Company |

> Example id=25&commercial=1&start_date=2019-12-03 
  

### Request Params (for sorting)

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **sort_by** | Options available: `id, created_at, first_name, last_name` |
| **sort_order** | Options available: `asc, desc` |

> Example

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves all customers of the company.

#### Request Params

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **includes\[\]** | Options available: `phones, address, billing, rep, jobs, contacts, canvasser, call_center_rep, referred_by` |

> Example `includes[]=phones&includes[]=address` 
  

#### includes\[\] Details

> phones 
  

The Phone number information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"phones": {
    "data": [
        {
            "label": "home",
            "number": "1111122222",
            "ext": null
        }
    ]
}

 ```

phones field will have the list of Phone numbers associated with the customer.

##### Phones field detail

\* **label**: Phone number label for example. Home, office.  
\* **number**: Phone number.  
\* **ext**: Optional phone number extension for example. +1.

> address 
  

The customer address information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"address": {

          "id": 5,

Address will have all the information related job like address id, state country, postcode etc.

##### Address field detail

\* **id**: Unique address id  
\* **address**: The street address  
\* **address_line_1**: An optional additional field for the street address  
\* **city**: The city, town, or village of the address  
\* **state**: State information of the address  
\* **country_id**: Id of the Country associated with the address  
\* **country**: Country information of the address with all the details.

> billing 
  

The billing address of the customer and fields will be the same as customer address.

> rep

item.description:
Help Leap users manage their customer data.

# Customer Object

| Key | Description |
| --- | --- |
| id | Customer's id |
| first_name | First name |
| last_name | Last Name |
| email | Customer's email |
| additional_emails | Customer's added additional emails |
| referred_by_type | Referred by user |
| referred_by_note | Referred note |
| call_required | If call required or not |
| appointment_required | If appointment required or not |
| note | Customer note |
| is_commercial | Specify whether the customer is a commercial customer |
| company_name | company name of the commercial customers |
| created_at | The date and time when the customer was created. |
| management_company | Customer's Management Company |
| property_name | Property Name |
| canvasser | Canvasser Name |
| canvasser_type | Canvasser Type : user, other |
| canvasser_id | Canvasser's Id if type is user |
| call_center_rep | Call centre representative |
| call_center_rep_type | Call centre representative Type: user, other |
| call_center_rep_id | Call centre representative's Id if type is user |

 ```

request.description:
## File Name

If additional_data.file_name is supplied during the request, that name will be used within Leap CRM. If not, it will automatically be named "**Results Worksheet**".

### Material Item List

Added by looping through worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems array adding any items that are marked as **worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.isActive=true** and mapping the below values to the worksheet structure.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Materials” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price**
    
    1. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 1, use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.price - ex. 800
        
    2. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 0, leave blank
        

### Tiers

JSON's worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category will be used to organize material list into groups

1. Only enabled if _more than one_ category is present.
    
    1. Will use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category as the Tier Name
        
    2. Tiers will be ordered alphabetically
        

### Generate Labor Items Option

If the “additional_data.generate_labor” option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will be inserted into the worksheet alongside the material items in a “staggered” manner. The structure will be much like the Material Items, above.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Labor” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - "Install "&worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Install Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.vestimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price** - leave empty
    

  

While using the Create Worksheet API, `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` or `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` can be provided which will indicate that this item is a combination of material and/or labor that maps to a Leap CRM macro.

## Tier/Sub-Tier Creation for Each Macro

If the`estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` provided matches a Macro ID in my Leap CRM subscription then…

### Tier Structure

1. If there is only one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Tier will be created to house the contents of the Macro to be applied.
    
2. If there is more than one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Sub-Tier will be created _within_ the Category-based Tier.
    

The Tier (or Sub-Tier) will be created with the following properties…

1. **Name** - `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name` - ex. “Duration”
    
2. **Description** - `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name` - ex. “Shingles”
    

It will then be populated with the contents of the Macro (as if applied with the “Select Macro(s)” functionality within the worksheet UI).

If both `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` _and_ `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` are provided, `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` will be used since it is the more _specific_ selection within SalesPro.

### Generate Labor Behavior

If the `generate_labor` option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will _not_ be applied to Tiers populated based on the contents of a Macro. This is to allow the _macros_ to control what Labor, if any, is included. However, if there are other items within the Estimate that do not map to Macros, labor items _will_ be created.

### Apply Measurement to the Worksheet

If `estimate.measurement_id`is provided and it matches the ID of a Measurement File associated with the job, once the Worksheet is built the Measurement File will be applied, instantiating any formulas associated with the items within the Estimate, where applicable.

request.description:
## File Name

If additional_data.file_name is supplied during the request, that name will be used within Leap CRM. If not, it will automatically be named "**Results Worksheet**".

### Material Item List

Added by looping through worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems array adding any items that are marked as **worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.isActive=true** and mapping the below values to the worksheet structure.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Materials” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price**
    
    1. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 1, use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.price - ex. 800
        
    2. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 0, leave blank
        

### Tiers

JSON's worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category will be used to organize material list into groups

1. Only enabled if _more than one_ category is present.
    
    1. Will use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category as the Tier Name
        
    2. Tiers will be ordered alphabetically
        

### Generate Labor Items Option

If the “additional_data.generate_labor” option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will be inserted into the worksheet alongside the material items in a “staggered” manner. The structure will be much like the Material Items, above.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Labor” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - "Install "&worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Install Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.vestimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price** - leave empty
    

While using the Create Worksheet API, `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` or `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` can be provided which will indicate that this item is a combination of material and/or labor that maps to a Leap CRM macro.

## Tier/Sub-Tier Creation for Each Macro

If the`estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` provided matches a Macro ID in my Leap CRM subscription then…

### Tier Structure

1. If there is only one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Tier will be created to house the contents of the Macro to be applied.
    
2. If there is more than one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Sub-Tier will be created _within_ the Category-based Tier.
    

The Tier (or Sub-Tier) will be created with the following properties…

1. **Name** - `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name` - ex. “Duration”
    
2. **Description** - `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name` - ex. “Shingles”
    

It will then be populated with the contents of the Macro (as if applied with the “Select Macro(s)” functionality within the worksheet UI).

If both `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` _and_ `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` are provided, `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` will be used since it is the more _specific_ selection within SalesPro.

### Generate Labor Behavior

If the `generate_labor` option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will _not_ be applied to Tiers populated based on the contents of a Macro. This is to allow the _macros_ to control what Labor, if any, is included. However, if there are other items within the Estimate that do not map to Macros, labor items _will_ be created.

### Apply Measurement to the Worksheet

If `estimate.measurement_id`is provided and it matches the ID of a Measurement File associated with the job, once the Worksheet is built the Measurement File will be applied, instantiating any formulas associated with the items within the Estimate, where applicable.

request.description:
## File Name

If additional_data.file_name is supplied during the request, that name will be used within Leap CRM. If not, it will automatically be named "**Results Worksheet**".

### Material Item List

Added by looping through worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems array adding any items that are marked as **worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.isActive=true** and mapping the below values to the worksheet structure.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Materials” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price**
    
    1. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 1, use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.price - ex. 800
        
    2. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 0, leave blank
        

### Tiers

JSON's worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category will be used to organize material list into groups

1. Only enabled if _more than one_ category is present.
    
    1. Will use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category as the Tier Name
        
    2. Tiers will be ordered alphabetically
        

### Generate Labor Items Option

If the “additional_data.generate_labor” option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will be inserted into the worksheet alongside the material items in a “staggered” manner. The structure will be much like the Material Items, above.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Labor” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - "Install "&worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Install Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.vestimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price** - leave empty
    

While using the Create Worksheet API, `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` or `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` can be provided which will indicate that this item is a combination of material and/or labor that maps to a Leap CRM macro.

## Tier/Sub-Tier Creation for Each Macro

If the`estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` provided matches a Macro ID in my Leap CRM subscription then…

### Tier Structure

1. If there is only one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Tier will be created to house the contents of the Macro to be applied.
    
2. If there is more than one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Sub-Tier will be created _within_ the Category-based Tier.
    

The Tier (or Sub-Tier) will be created with the following properties…

1. **Name** - `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name` - ex. “Duration”
    
2. **Description** - `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name` - ex. “Shingles”
    

It will then be populated with the contents of the Macro (as if applied with the “Select Macro(s)” functionality within the worksheet UI).

If both `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` _and_ `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` are provided, `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` will be used since it is the more _specific_ selection within SalesPro.

### Generate Labor Behavior

If the `generate_labor` option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will _not_ be applied to Tiers populated based on the contents of a Macro. This is to allow the _macros_ to control what Labor, if any, is included. However, if there are other items within the Estimate that do not map to Macros, labor items _will_ be created.

### Apply Measurement to the Worksheet

If `estimate.measurement_id`is provided and it matches the ID of a Measurement File associated with the job, once the Worksheet is built the Measurement File will be applied, instantiating any formulas associated with the items within the Estimate, where applicable.

request.description:
## File Name

If additional_data.file_name is supplied during the request, that name will be used within Leap CRM. If not, it will automatically be named "**Results Worksheet**".

### Material Item List

Added by looping through worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems array adding any items that are marked as **worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.isActive=true** and mapping the below values to the worksheet structure.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Materials” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price**
    
    1. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 1, use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.price - ex. 800
        
    2. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 0, leave blank
        

### Tiers

JSON's worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category will be used to organize material list into groups

1. Only enabled if _more than one_ category is present.
    
    1. Will use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category as the Tier Name
        
    2. Tiers will be ordered alphabetically
        

### Generate Labor Items Option

If the “additional_data.generate_labor” option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will be inserted into the worksheet alongside the material items in a “staggered” manner. The structure will be much like the Material Items, above.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Labor” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - "Install "&worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Install Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.vestimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price** - leave empty
    

While using the Create Worksheet API, `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` or `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` can be provided which will indicate that this item is a combination of material and/or labor that maps to a Leap CRM macro.

## Tier/Sub-Tier Creation for Each Macro

If the`estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` provided matches a Macro ID in my Leap CRM subscription then…

### Tier Structure

1. If there is only one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Tier will be created to house the contents of the Macro to be applied.
    
2. If there is more than one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Sub-Tier will be created _within_ the Category-based Tier.
    

The Tier (or Sub-Tier) will be created with the following properties…

1. **Name** - `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name` - ex. “Duration”
    
2. **Description** - `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name` - ex. “Shingles”
    

It will then be populated with the contents of the Macro (as if applied with the “Select Macro(s)” functionality within the worksheet UI).

If both `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` _and_ `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` are provided, `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` will be used since it is the more _specific_ selection within SalesPro.

### Generate Labor Behavior

If the `generate_labor` option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will _not_ be applied to Tiers populated based on the contents of a Macro. This is to allow the _macros_ to control what Labor, if any, is included. However, if there are other items within the Estimate that do not map to Macros, labor items _will_ be created.

### Apply Measurement to the Worksheet

If `estimate.measurement_id`is provided and it matches the ID of a Measurement File associated with the job, once the Worksheet is built the Measurement File will be applied, instantiating any formulas associated with the items within the Estimate, where applicable.

request.description:
## File Name

If additional_data.file_name is supplied during the request, that name will be used within Leap CRM. If not, it will automatically be named "**Results Worksheet**".

### Material Item List

Added by looping through worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems array adding any items that are marked as **worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.isActive=true** and mapping the below values to the worksheet structure.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Materials” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price**
    
    1. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 1, use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.price - ex. 800
        
    2. If “additional_data.include_pricing” = 0, leave blank
        

### Tiers

JSON's worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category will be used to organize material list into groups

1. Only enabled if _more than one_ category is present.
    
    1. Will use worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category as the Tier Name
        
    2. Tiers will be ordered alphabetically
        

### Generate Labor Items Option

If the “additional_data.generate_labor” option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will be inserted into the worksheet alongside the material items in a “staggered” manner. The structure will be much like the Material Items, above.

1. **Type** - hardcoded to “Labor” dropdown option
    
2. **Quantity** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.quantity
    
3. **Unit** - worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.measurementType
    
4. **Name** - "Install "&worksheet_data.estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name - ex. “Install Duration”
    
5. **Description** - worksheet_data.vestimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name - ex. “Shingles”
    
6. **Selling Price** - leave empty
    

While using the Create Worksheet API, `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` or `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` can be provided which will indicate that this item is a combination of material and/or labor that maps to a Leap CRM macro.

## Tier/Sub-Tier Creation for Each Macro

If the`estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` provided matches a Macro ID in my Leap CRM subscription then…

### Tier Structure

1. If there is only one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Tier will be created to house the contents of the Macro to be applied.
    
2. If there is more than one `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.category`, a Sub-Tier will be created _within_ the Category-based Tier.
    

The Tier (or Sub-Tier) will be created with the following properties…

1. **Name** - `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.name` - ex. “Duration”
    
2. **Description** - `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.name` - ex. “Shingles”
    

It will then be populated with the contents of the Macro (as if applied with the “Select Macro(s)” functionality within the worksheet UI).

If both `estimate.addedItems.X.measureSheetItem.macro_id` _and_ `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` are provided, `estimate.addedItems.X.selectedOption.macro_id` will be used since it is the more _specific_ selection within SalesPro.

### Generate Labor Behavior

If the `generate_labor` option is supplied and equals 1 (indicating true), labor items will _not_ be applied to Tiers populated based on the contents of a Macro. This is to allow the _macros_ to control what Labor, if any, is included. However, if there are other items within the Estimate that do not map to Macros, labor items _will_ be created.

### Apply Measurement to the Worksheet

If `estimate.measurement_id`is provided and it matches the ID of a Measurement File associated with the job, once the Worksheet is built the Measurement File will be applied, instantiating any formulas associated with the items within the Estimate, where applicable.

request.description:
Get a single job by id

#### Request Parameters

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **includes\[\]** | Options Available: `address, estimators, reps, customer, sub_contractors, projects, work_types, trades, job_notes, division` |

> Example `includes[]=address&includes[]=customer` 
  

#### Includes\[\] Details

> address 
  

The address information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"address": {
      "id": 327,
      "address": "Teasley Lane",
      "address_line_1": "",
      "city": "",
      "state_id": 5,
      "state": {
          "id": 5,
          "name": "California",
          "code": "CA",
          "country_id": 1
      },
      "country_id": 1,
      "country": {
          "id": 1,
          "name": "United States",
          "code": "US",
          "phone_code": "+1"
      },
      "zip": "77375",
      "lat": 10.812973,
      "long": -16.978363
  }

 ```

Address will have all the information related to Address like address id, state country, postcode etc.

##### Address field detail

- **id**: Unique address id
    
- **address**: The street address
    
- **address_line_1**: An optional additional field for the street address
    
- **city**: The city, town, or village of the address
    
- **state**: State information of the address
    
- **country_id**: Id of the Country associated with the address
    
- **country**: Country information of the address with all the details.
    
- **lat**: The latitude of the address.
    
- **long**: The longitude of the address.
    

> reps 
  

The representative information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"reps": {
      "data": [
          {
              "id": 25,
              "first_name": "John",
              "last_name": "Doe",
              "email": "john@example.com",
              "company_id": 6,
              "company": "John Constructions",
              "admin_privilege": false,
              "group": {
                  "id": 5,
                  "name": "owner"
              },
              "added_date": "2019-11-15 05:53:09",
              "profile_pic": null,
              "active": true,
              "company_name": null,
              "color": "blue",
              "role": [
                  {
                      "name": "plus-admin"
                  }
              ]
          }
      ]
  }

 ```

Reps will have the list of representatives associated with the job.

##### Reps field detail

- **id**: Unique representative id
    
- **first_name**: First name of the representative.
    
- **last_name**: Last name of the representative.
    
- **email**: Email of the representative.
    
- **company_id**: Company id of the representative associated with.
    
- **company**: Company details of the representative.
    
- **admin_privilege**: shows if representative has admin privileges or not.
    
- **group**: User group information of the representative.
    
- **added_date**: The date and time when the representative was created in the system.
    
- **profile_pic**: Profile picture of the representative.
    
- **active**: Shows if representative is active or not.
    
- **company_name**: Company name of the representative if user is commercial.
    
- **color**: Color information associated with representative.
    
- **role**: Role information of the representative.
    

> customer 
  

The customer information that will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"customer": {
    "id": 6158400,
    "company_name": "",
    "first_name": "Calvin",
    "last_name": "Lowell",
    "email": "234@gmail.com",
    "additional_emails": [],
    "referred_by_type": "",
    "referred_by_note": "",
    "call_required": false,
    "appointment_required": false,
    "note": "",
    "is_commercial": 0,
    "created_at": "2024-09-18 14:56:42",
    "updated_at": "2024-09-23 11:24:17",
    "deleted_at": null,
    "management_company": "",
    "property_name": "",
    "canvasser_type": "",
    "canvasser": "",
    "call_center_rep_type": "",
    "call_center_rep": "",
    "phones": {
        "data": [
            {
                "label": "phone",
                "number": "1111111111",
                "ext": ""
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

Customer field will have customer data associated with the job.

##### Customer field detail

- **id**: Unique customer id
    
- **first_name**: First name of the customer.
    
- **last_name**: Last name of the customer.
    
- **email**: Email of the customer.
    
- **additional_emails**: Additional emails of the customer.
    
- **referred_by_type**: Customer referral type (referral, customer, other).
    
- **referred_by_note**: if `referred_by_type` is `other` then this field will have referral note.
    
- **call_required**: If call required or not when added.
    
- **appointment_required**: If appointment required or not when added.
    
- **note**: Note will have notes about the customer.
    
- **is_commercial**: If individual or commercial.
    
- **created_at**: The date and time when the customer was created.
    
- **deleted_at**: The date and time when the customer was deleted.
    
- **management_company**: Management company of the customer.
    
- **canvasser**: Canvasser Name.
    
- **call_center_rep**: Call centre representative.
    
- **phones**: Phones field will have the list of Phone numbers associated with the customer.  
    Phones field detail
    
    - **label**: Phone number label for example. Home, office.
        
    - **number**: Phone number.
        
    - **ext**: Optional phone number extension for example. +1.
        

> sub_contractors 
  

The Sub Contractor Users information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
  "sub_contractors": {
     "data": [
        {
            "id": 28,
            "first_name": "Sub",
            "last_name": "Contractor 1",
            "email": "example@gmail.com",
            "company_name": "",
            "additional_phone": [],
            "address": "422 Massachusetts Avenue",
            "address_line_1": "",
            "zip": "10",
            "city": "Alabama",
            "country": {
                "id": 4,
                "name": "Canada",
                "code": "CA",
                "phone_code": "+1"
            },
            "country_id": "4",
            "state": {
                "id": 4,
                "name": "Arkansas",
                "code": "AR",
                "country_id": 1
            },
            "state_id": 4,
            "type": "sub_contractor",
            "is_active": true,
            "profile_pic": null,
            "trades": [],
            "created_at": "2019-11-22 05:21:34",
            "updated_at": "2019-11-22 05:21:34",
            "note": "",
            "rating": 0,
            "work_types": [],
            "color": "#FE6F5E"
        }
     ]
 }

 ```

sub_contractors field will have the list of Sub Contractor Users associated with the job.

##### Sub Contractor user field detail

- **id**: Unique user id
    
- **first_name**: First name of the user.
    
- **last_name**: Last name of the user.
    
- **email**: Email of the user.
    
- **company_name**: Company name of the user.
    
- **additional_phone**: Additional phones details of the user.
    
- **address**: Street address of the user.
    
- **address_line_1**: An optional additional field for the street address
    
- **zip**: The postal code (zip, postcode) of the user address.
    
- **city**: City of the user.
    
- **country**: Country information of the address with all the details.
    
- **country_id**: Country id of the user.
    
- **state**: State information of the address
    
- **state_id**: State id of the user.
    
- **type**: User type information
    
- **is_active**: Shows if user is active or not
    
- **profile_pic**: profile picture of the user
    
- **trades**: Trades of the of the user
    
- **created_at**: The date and time when the user was created.
    
- **updated_at**: The date and time when the user was last updated.
    
- **note**: User notes
    
- **rating**: Rating of the user
    
- **work_types**: Work types of the user
    
- **color**: Color information attached with the user
    
    > projects 
      
    

The Projects information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
 "projects": {
    "data": [
        {
          "id": 105,
          "number": "1911-085-01-P1",
          "alt_id": "1551",
          "duration": "0:0:0",
          "created_at": "2019-11-27 10:42:11",
          "updated_at": "2019-11-28 14:20:28",
          "description": "asd",
          "parent_id": 104,
          "status": null,
          "awarded": 1
        }
    ]
}

 ```

projects field will have the list of Projects associated with the job.

##### Project field detail

- **id**: Unique project id
    
- **number**: Unique project number.
    
- **alt_id**: Alternate id.
    
- **duration**: Duration of the project.
    
- **created_at**: The date and time when the project was created.
    
- **updated_at**: The date and time when the project was last updated.
    
- **description**: Project description.
    
- **parent_id**: Parent job id associated with project.
    
- **status**: Status information of the project.
    
- **awarded**: Shows if job was awarded or not.
    

> work_types 
  

The Work type information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
 "work_types": {
     "data": [
         {
           "id": 12,
           "name": "asdf",
           "trade_id": 31,
           "color": "#0D98BA"
         }
     ]
 }

 ```

work_types field will have the list of work types associated with the job.

##### Work type field detail

- **id**: Unique project id
    
- **name**: Work type name.
    
- **trade_id**: Trade id associated with work type.
    
- **color**: Color information associated with work type.
    

> job_notes 
  

The job note information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
 "job_notes": {
     "data": [
         {
           "id": 1,
           "stage_code": "300966607",
           "note": "This is an example of a job note",
           "created_at": "2020-02-28 09:26:28",
           "updated_at": "2020-02-28 09:26:28"
         }
     ]
 }

 ```

job_notes field will have the list of notes associated with the job.

##### Job note field detail

- **id**: Unique job note id.
    
- **stage_code**: Unique code of job workflow stage when job note was created.
    
- **note**: Job note detail.
    
- **created_at**: The date and time when the job note was created.
    
- **updated_at**: The date and time when the job note was last updated.

request.description:
# Get the list of jobs #### Request Params | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **includes\[\]** | Options of options: `address, estimators, reps, customer, sub_contractors, projects, work_types, trades, division, deleted_by` | Example `includes[]=address&includes[]=customer` #### includes\[\] Details Includes\[\] information returned will be same as in the view single job section. ### Request Parameters (for filtering):- | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **job_number** | Job number | | **trades\[\]** | Array of trade ids | | **work_types\[\]** | Array of ids(job types 2) | | **rep_ids** | Array of customer's **rep Ids** or **(string) unassigned** | | **job_rep_ids** | Array of job's **rep Ids** or **(string) unassigned** | | **estimator_ids** | Array of job's **estimator Ids** or **(string) unassigned** | | **labor_ids** | Array of **labour Ids** or **(string) unassigned** | | **sub_ids** | Array of job's **sub contractors Ids** or **(string) unassigned** | | **stages\[\]** | Array of stage codes | | **name** | Job name | | **address** | Address field of customer | | **customer_name** | Customer first name | | **customer_id** | ID associate to customer | | **zip_code** | customer address zip code | | **job_types\[\]** | Array of ids(job types 1) | | **work_types\[\]** | Array of ids(job types 1) | | **include_lost_jobs** | Send 1 to include lost jobs or projects forcefully | | **exclude_pb_jobs** | boolean(1 or 0)true or false | | **priority\[\]** | array of values(low, medium, high) | | **with_archived** | boolean(1 or 0)true or false | | **only_archived** | boolean(1 or 0)true or false | | **with_archived_project** | boolean(1 or 0)true or false | | **only_archived_project** | boolean(1 or 0)true or false | | **multi_jobs_only** | boolean(1, 0)for multi jobs only | | **exclude_multijobs** | boolean(1, 0)for single jobs only (exclude projects and multi job) | | **date_range_type** | (optional)(job_created_date, job_stage_changed_date, job_updated_date) by default is job_created_date | | **start_date** | (optional)(Y-m-d) | | **end_date** | (optional)(Y-m-d) | | **job_city** | (optional)(name of the city) | | **job_cities\[\]** | (optional)(array of cities) | | **customer_type** | 'commercial' or 'residential' | | **unassigned** | boolean(1 or 0)true or false to get unassigned jobs | | **start_date** | start date | | **end_date** | end date | | **awarded_jobs** | boolean(1, 0) 1 for awarded jobs only | | **awarded_from** | Awarded From (Y-m-d) - this filter will work in case of awarded_jobs is sent as 1 | | **awarded_to** | Awarded To (Y-m-d) - this filter will work in case of awarded_jobs is sent as 1 | | **parent_ids\[\]** | Array of parent Job ids | | **job_ids\[\]** | Array of Job ids | | **exclude_parent** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to exclude parent jobs from the listing | | **projects_only** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get only projects in the listing | | **project_ids\[\]** | Array of project ids | | **exclude_job_types\[\]** | Array of ids(job types 1) whose jobs need to be excluded from the list | | **sales_performance_for\[\]** | Array of options (customer_rep, estimator) | | **user_ids\[\]** | Array of use ids(assosiate to customer rep or estimator)
Note: This filter will not work without sales_performance_for | | **first_name** | First Name of the job's customer | | **last_name** | Last Name of the job's customer | | **job_address** | Job's address (Any one from address, city or zip) | | **cities\[\]** | Array of Customer's city | | **wp_jobs** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get only wordpress leads in the listing | | **job_zip_code** | Job's zip code | | **for_bid_proposal** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to Get only bid proposal's jobs | | **for_accepted_proposal** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to Get only accepted proposal's jobs | | **has_change_orders** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to Get only those jobs who have change orders | | **job_contact_person** | Job's contact person's name | | **project_number** | Project Number | | **project_alt_id** | Project Alt ID (#) | | **exclude_bad_leads** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to exclude bad leads from the listing
(To exclude those jobs whose customer has assigned with bad lead flag)

Note: Awarded Jobs will be returned in the listing, even the customer has bad lead flag | | **bad_leads** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get only bad leads in the listing
(To whose customer has assigned with bad lead flag)

Note: Awarded Jobs will not be returned in the listing | | **unassigned_cr** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get Jobs which don't have any customer representative | | **job_flag_ids\[\]** | Array of flag ids | | **referred_type\[\]** | Array of types (customer, other, referral) | | **without_schedules** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get Jobs without schedule in the listing | | **created_date** | Job's created date (Y-m-d) | | **updated_date** | Job's updated date (Y-m-d) | | **stage_changed_date** | Job's stage change date (Y-m-d) | | **include_deleted_jobs** | boolean(1, 0), 1 to include deleted jobs in the listing. | Example `job_number=62515`

response.body:

    "data": [
        {

item.description:
Help Leap users to manage their jobs data.

# Job Object

| Key | Type and Description |
| --- | --- |
| id | Job id |
| name | Job name |
| number | Job number |
| customer_id | Id of the customers to which this job belongs |
| description | Description of the jobs |
| same_as_customer_address | Boolean value which specifies whether the job address is same as customer address. |
| other_trade_type_description | Other trade type description |
| created_by | Id of the user who created the job in the system. |
| created_at | The date and time when the job was created in the system. |
| updated_at | The date and time when the job was last updated in the system. |
| call_required | Boolean flag which specify whether there is call to be scheduled with the customer |
| appointment_required | Boolean flag which specify whether there an appointment to be scheduled with the customer |
| tax_rate | Percentage Tax rate applied for the job |
| alt_id | Manually entered ID for the job. |
| lead_number | Manually entered Lead Number for the job. |
| duration | Approximate time required for the job (format 0:0:0) |
| completion_date | Approximate completetion date for the job. |
| contract_signed_date | The date and time when the job proposal was signed by the customer. |
| current_stage | Stage Object of the current stage of the job. |
| contact_same_as_customer | 1 or 0 |

item.description: This API can be used to create a customer and job in a single API call. When you hit this API you pass information for both customers and job.

item.name: Company

request.description:
Retrieve all trades of the company.

#### Request Params

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **includes\[\]** | Options of options: `work_types, attributes.unit, attributes.sub_attributes.unit` |

> Example `includes[]=work_types` 
  

#### includes\[\] Details

> work_types 
  

The Work type information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"work_types": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 12,
            "name": "window",
            "trade_id": 31,
            "color": "#0D98BA"
        },
        {
            "id": 11,
            "name": "clearnig",
            "trade_id": 31,
            "color": "#FE6F5E"
        }
    ]
}

 ```

work_types will have the list of the work types.

##### Work type field detail

- **id**: Unique project id
    
- **name**: Work type name.
    
- **trade_id**: Trade id associated with work type.
    
- **color**: Color information associated with work type.
    

#### includes\[\] Details

> attributes.unit 
  

The Attribute and unit information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"attributes": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 300561,
            "name": "Linear ft",
            "slug": "trade_id_200_slug_linear_ft",
            "locked": false,

            "unit": {
                "id": 2,
                "name": "Feet",
                "display_name": "Feet (ft)"
             }
          },

      ]
}

 ```

attributes will have the list of the attributes of a trade.

##### Attributes field detail

- **id**: Unique Attribute's id
    
- **name**: Attribute's name.
    
- **slug**: Attribute's Slug.
    
- **locked**: Indicate whether the attribute is locked or not
    
- **unit**: Provide the unit of the attribute
    
- **unit.id**: Unique Unit's id
    
- **unit.name**: Unit's name.
    
- **unit.display_name**: Unit's Dipsplay Name (by which name it would be showing in the Leap CRM).
    

#### includes\[\] Details

> attributes.sub_attributes.unit 
  

The Attribute and unit information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
"attributes": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 35382,
            "name": "Square ft",
            "slug": "trade_id_80_slug_square_ft",
            "locked": false,
            "sub_attributes": {
                "data": [
                    {
                        "id": 303646,
                        "name": "Nominal",
                        "slug": "parent_slug_trade_id_80_slug_square_ft_slug_nominal",
                        "locked": false,
                        "unit": {
                            "id": 3,
                            "name": "Inch",
                            "display_name": "Inch (i)"
                        }
                    }
                ]
            }
        },
    ]
}

 ```

attributes will have the list of the attributes of a trade.

##### Attributes field detail

- **id**: Unique Attribute's id
    
- **name**: Attribute's name.
    
- **slug**: Attribute's Slug.
    
- **locked**: Indicate whether the attribute is locked or not
    
- **sub_attributes:** Provide the Sub Attributes of the attribute
    
- **sub_attributes.id**: Unique Sub Attribute's id
    
- **sub_attributes.name**: Sub Attribute's name.
    
- **sub_attributes.slug**: Sub Attribute's Slug.
    
- **sub_attributes.locked**: Indicate whether the sub attribute is locked or not
    
- **sub_attributes.unit**: Provide the unit of the sub attribute
    
- **sub_attributes.unit.id**: Unique Unit's id
    
- **sub_attributes.unit.name**: Unit's name.
    
- **sub_attributes.unit.display_name**: Unit's Dipsplay Name (by which name it would be showing in the Leap CRM).

item.name: User

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves all users of the company. ##### Request Params | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **Includes\[\]** | Array of keys :- **profile** | #### includes\[\] Details > profile The profile information will be returned by includes in the format below: ``` json "profile": { "id": 18, "user_id": 25, "phone": null, "additional_phone": null, "address": "123 Nassau Street", "address_line_1": "", "city": "New York", "state_id": 32, "state": "New York", "country_id": 1, "country": "United States", "zip": "10038", "position": "", "profile_pic": null } ``` profile field will have all the information of profile associated with the user. ##### Profile field detail - **id**: Unique id - **user_id**: User id associated with profile. - **phone**: Phone details of user profile. - **additional_phone**: Additional phones details of user profile. - **address**: Street address of the user profile. - **address_line_1**: An optional additional field for the street address - **city**: City of the user profile. - **state_id**: State id of the user profile. - **state**: State information of the address - **country_id**: Country id of the user profile. - **country**: Country information of the address with all the details. - **zip**: The postal code (zip, postcode) of the user profile address. - **position**: Position of the user. - **profile_pic**: profile picture of the user ##### Request Params (for sorting) | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **sort_by** | Options available: `first_name, email, created_at, group_id` | | **sort_order** | Options available: `asc, desc` | > Example `?sort_by=id&sort_order=asc` ##### Filters:- | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **active** | boolean (0 or 1) | | **inactive** | boolean (0 or 1) | | **division_ids\[\]** | Array of division ids (in which division, the user belongs) | | **keyword** | Partial search on user’s first name, last name and email
(Eg. User’s first name is John and we are searching Joh or John in both the cases this filter will return the user) | | **with_inactive** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get Both active/inactive users in the listing | | **user_ids\[\]** | Array of user ids (particular id of a user)

| | **only_sub_contractors** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get only SubContractors in the listing | | **user_id\[\]** | Array of user ids > Example `?inactive=1` ##### searching:- | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **query** | Search keyword | > Example `?query=John`

request.description:
Get the list of job notes by id

#### Request Parameters

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **includes\[\]** | Options Available: `created_by, modified_by` |

> Example `includes[]=created_by` 
  

#### Includes\[\] Details

> created_by 
  

The created_by information will be returned by includes in the format below:

``` json
    "created_by": {
        "id": 25,
        "first_name": "John",
        "last_name": "Doe",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "company_id": 6,
        "company": "John Constructions",
        "admin_privilege": false,
        "group": {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "owner"
         },
        "added_date": "2019-11-15 05:53:09",
        "profile_pic": null,
        "active": true,
        "company_name": null,
        "color": "blue",
        "role": [
           {
                "name": "plus-admin"
            }
        ]
    }

```

created_by field will have all the information related to user who created the job note like user id, first name, last name etc.

##### created_by field detail

- **id**: Unique user id.
- **first_name**: First name of the user.
- **last_name**: Last name of the user.
- **email**: Email of the user.
- **company_id**: Company id of the user.
- **company**: Company details of the user.
- **admin_privilege**: shows if user has admin privileges or not.
- **group**: User group information of the user.
- **added_date**: The date and time when the user was created in the system.
- **profile_pic**: Profile picture of the user.
- **active**: Shows if user is active or not.
- **company_name**: Company name of the user if user is commercial.
- **color**: Color information associated with user.
- **role**: Role information of the user.
    

> modified_by 
  

modified_by fields detail will be same as created_by.

request.description:
# Get the list of Appointments #### Request Params | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **includes\[\]** | Options of options: `user, attendees, jobs, result_option, reminders, customer` | #### user Same as user object #### attendees Same as user object #### jobs Same as jobs object #### result_option Same as result_option object #### reminders It will have Array of reminders with information like remider type, id and other details. > Example `includes[]=user&includes[]=attendees` ### Request Parameters (for filtering):- | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **duration** | Duration type filter (option: date, upcoming, today) | | **date_range_type** | Date range type filter (options: appointment_created_date or appointment_updated_date). This filter will only work when start date or end date filter will come. | | **start_date** | Start date (optional field) - The datetime format should be YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, for example, 2023-06-20 05:59:59. Please note that the datetime will be interpreted as UTC time. | | **end_date** | End date (optional field) - The datetime format should be YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, for example, 2023-06-20 05:59:59. Please note that the datetime will be interpreted as UTC time. | | **for** | Get filtered appointments for specific users **(string) unassigned** | | **users** | Array of Users's | | **customer_id** |

ID of a particular customer

| | **job_ids\[\]** | Array of job Ids | | **created_by** | ID of a particular user who created the appointment | | **with_job** | boolean(1, 0) 1 to get only those appointments which are created under job and pass 0 to get only those appointments which are created without job | | **division_ids\[\]** | Array of job’s division ids
(To get only those job’s appointments which belongs to a particular division) | | **category_ids\[\]** | Array of job’s category ids
(To get only those job’s appointments which belongs to a particular category) | | **trades\[\]** | Array of job’s trade ids
(To get only those job’s appointments which belongs to a particular trade) | | **work_types\[\]** | Array of job’s work type ids
(To get only those job’s appointments which belongs to a particular work type) | | **job_flag_ids\[\]** |

Array of job’s flag ids
(To get only those job’s appointments which belongs to a particular flag)

| | **cities\[\]** | Array of job’s cities
(To get only those job’s appointments which belongs to a particular city) | | **repeat** |

boolean(1, 0) 1 to get only those appointments which are created recursively

| > Example `start_date=2023-06-20 05:59:59` ### Request Params (for sorting) | Name | Value | | --- | --- | | **sort_by** | Options available: `id` | | **sort_order** | Options available: `asc, desc` | > Example `?sort_by=id&sort_order=asc`

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves all vendor bills of the jobs.
#### Request Params 
| Name | Value |
--- | --- |
| **includes[]** | Options available: `attachments, vendor, lines`

> Example `includes[]=vendor&includes[]=attachments&includes[]=lines`

#### includes[] Details

> vendor

The Vendor information will be returned by includes in the format below:

```json
"vendor": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "first_name": "Punit",
            "last_name": "Khitouliya",
            "display_name": "Punit",
            "origin": "JobProgress"
        }
    ]
}
```

#####  Vendor field detail

* **id**: Vendor Id
* **first_name**: Vendor First Name
* **last_name**: Vendor Last Name
* **display_name**: Vendor Display Name
* **origin**: Vendor is created from JobProgress or Quickbooks

> attachments

The Attachments information will be returned by includes in the format below::

```json
"attachments": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 4424,
            "parent_id": 3736,
            "name": "jassi_gill",
            "size": 39279,
            "mime_type": "application/pdf",
            "meta": [],
            "url": "https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/staging.jp.company.resources/resources/yourstardom_1582003724/vendor_bill_attachments/1603437719_790021447.pdf?X-Amz-Content-Sha256=UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD&X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Credential=AKIAIBTK6IZBMLWXCRNA%2F20201125%2Fus-west-2%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Date=20201125T122412Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=1200&X-Amz-Signature=29421ac6e37abfa53f61099fed1ebb0e448a67b59f21161a0b155ce2f7f6c15d"
        }
    ]
}
```

#####  Attachments Field Detail
* **id**: Unique Attachments id
* **parent_id**: Unique Parent id of attachment
* **name**: Name of the attachment
* **size**: Size of the attachment
* **mime_type**: Mime Type of the attachment
* **url**: URL of the attachment


> lines
```json
"lines": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 216,
            "account_id": 1,
            "rate": "1230.00",
            "description": "Lorem",
            "quantity": "232.00"
        }
    ]
}
```

##### LINES FIELD DETAIL
* **id**: Unique Line id
* **account_id**: Unique Account id of Line Item
* **rate**: Rate of the Line Item
* **description**: Description of the Line Item
* **quantity**: Quantity of the Line Item

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves all invoices of the jobs.

### Request Parameters (for filtering):-
| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| **status** | open, closed and all (By Default, open status will apply)

#### Request Params 
| Name | Value |
--- | --- |
| **includes[]** | Options available: `lines, custom_tax`

> Example `includes[]=lines&includes[]=custom_tax`

#### includes[] Details


> lines
```json
"lines": {
    "data": [
        {
            "amount": "25.999",
            "description": "Achintya Vikram",
            "quantity": "25.999",
            "product_id": null,
            "is_chargeable": 1,
            "work_type": {
                "id": 6,
                "name": "Insurance",
                "color": "#FE6F5E"
            },
            "trade": {
                "id": 60,
                "name": "APPLIANCES"
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

##### LINES FIELD DETAIL
* **amount**: Amount of a line item
* **description**: Description of a line item
* **quantity**: Quantity of a line item
* **product_id**: Product Id of a line item
* **is_chargeable**: (Boolean) Is line item chargeable or not
* **work_type**: Work Type of a line item
* **trade**: Trade of a line item

> custom_tax
The custom_tax information will be returned by includes in the format below:

```json
"custom_tax": {
    "data": [
        {
            "id": "25",
            "title": "Achintya Vikram",
            "tax_rate": "2.9",
            "created_at": "2020:02:11",
            "updated_at": "2020:02:11",
        }
    ]
}
```

##### LINES FIELD DETAIL
* **amount**: Amount of a line item
* **description**: Description of a line item
* **quantity**: Quantity of a line item
* **product_id**: Product Id of a line item
* **is_chargeable**: (Boolean) Is line item chargeable or not
* **work_type**: Work Type of a line item
* **trade**: Trade of a line item
